qas.question: How many different areas does BBC One accommodate with customized broadcasting?
Which parts of the UK have more control over their BBC broadcasts?
Who hosts shows on BBC broadcasts outside of England?
What kind of coverage might take precedence over standard BBC programming?
How many regions is BBC Two's output split up into?
What city are the announcers of Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland mostly from?

plausible_answers.text: variations also occur within the BBC One and BBC Two schedules

qas.question: What occurs between national and local BBC schedules?

context: National and regional <b6_0>variations also occur within the BBC One and BBC Two schedules<b6_0/>. England's BBC One output is split up into <a0_0><b4_0>fifteen<a0_0/> regions<b4_0/> (such as South West and East), which exist mainly to produce local news programming, but also occasionally opt out of the network to show programmes of local importance (such as <a3_0>major local events<a3_0/>). The other nations of the United Kingdom (<a1_0>Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland<a1_0/>) have been granted more autonomy from the English network; for example, programmes are mostly introduced by <a2_0>local announcers<a2_0/>, rather than by those in <b5_0>London<b5_0/>. BBC One and BBC Two schedules in the other UK nations can vary immensely from BBC One and BBC Two in England.
